intro: Mitesia floridana, commonly known as the Florida mitesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
